Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: 843JVD
Reviews.Content: It started with the beds, an 2 meter long bed on which you get backpain beyond believe. also the sheats wer dirty and had holes in them. the toilet does not work at random times during the night. mostly between 00:00 and 09:00. also the walls were dirty. the only good thing was the location which was fairly central. also if you want to check your email with the wifi you need to reconnect every 5 seconds. the site says you have oceonview in every room but you couldn't see anything but an ac unit and a wall in most rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Tayhan”
Reviews.Author: kcaw002
Reviews.Content: The staff is relatively friendly, although the room is just bare basic. The bathroom always gets flooded after our shower. The breakfast gets boring after our second day there as it is always the same every day. We were there for 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “To Be AVOID at any cost”
Reviews.Author: EricLaska
Reviews.Content: Everything Start the first minute we came in ... Non smiling and unpleasant receptionist ... we have reservation, and she got our name in her book, it was corresponding with our passport but she did not want to give us room if we could not provide the Printed reservation voucher ... for sure we both have had it in our computer to show her .. but she did not accepted it, she wanted the printed version ... and I'm sure that I'm like every business traveler ... I bring my laserjet printer with me all around the world ... 20 mns discussion only for that ... when we finally make it .. then she asked us to fill a paper to give our mother and father's name and surname ... I was in another hotel in Ankara the night before, and i was in the Asur Hotel in Istanbul (that I highly recommend) the 2 night before, and I was not questioned or Harassed like that just to check-in ... you can forget that anyone help you with luggage ... it does not seems include in the price (while it was the most expensive of the 3 hotels i went while in istanbul) Room are just as small as a kitchenette ... cleanliness is under average ... They have a minibar, but empty and unplug. and still, each time going in and out, have to ask the key to that girl who was unable to smile at all ... The day after, for the check out ... a smiling guy, finally, but for the worth... he asked us if we were going to the airport, and if so, the Hotel is working with a confident Taxi driver that he will call strait away to bring us to the airport ... I did understand the smile while, passing in front of the airport entrance, he manage to make us a full round around the airport which cost double the normal price, Thank you to this helping and smiling staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Helpfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: HoetjesPeeck
Reviews.Content: Never before have we had the pleasure of staying in a hotel with such a helpfull staff. Our room was on the top floor and had a superb view over the city and the sea. Unfortunately we had to abort our trip after two nights, which would have been much more unpleasant and expensive if it wasn't for the staff that helped us with endless patience and experise. Also lovely location within walking distance of many sights and next door to many nice local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “OK budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarEntre
Reviews.Content: This is a three star hotel, we had done the booking through a travel agent for the tour to Istanbul. The rooms are just about ok.The season we travelled was the beginning of winter and hence wedid not need any airconditioning since the temperature was between 10-15 degC. The hotel offers bed and breakfast, thougn the breakfast is passable.All the stuff on the menu for breakfast was cold and not palatable. No staff on the floor for the breakfast service. It lookked like they were short stafffed. Room service too was not upto the mark.The staff would have to be reminded time and again for the service. The only positive point is the location in the central area called Kumkapi which is famous all over Istanbul for the fish restaurants.Variety of fish available in the area and the restaurants outside the hotel offer a good variety. If you would just want to keep yopur bags and just rest for the night then this is an ok place,else you may look for accomodatio elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trygvenorway
Reviews.Content: Stayed there at the end of April 2009. The rooms were clean and quite ok.No noise from the street as I was in the backyard. A bit of noise from the school near by- didn't bother me. The breakfast was served in a very nice room, and it was very good included home made yougurt and vegetables. Descriotion to find the hotel could have been beter. You ought to change to the efficient tram station and go a couple of stops from Akasarry to Beyazit and down Methapasa street. The hotel is very central to the main tram line(which you will use a lot) and a lot of attractions. There is a little hill to climb to get to the tram- but nothing really if you are at good health. I could recommend this hotel if you want a good hotel at reasonable price. Trygve

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for 3 star! I wish come back there (if i''ll visite Ist)”
Reviews.Author: Caprae
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with a VERY POLITE and HELPFULL personal. Realy, personal in this hotel is very helpfull! Breakfast every day was the same "complect", but it was normal-standart breakfast. Room is nice, but too little (but you don't go to Ist for a hotel ;) ) A room-cleaner know her work and do it very very good!!! Realy good hotel for a normal price :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly but VERY basic”
Reviews.Author: HelzBelzW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Tayhan with a sports team who were competing in Istanbul. We selected the hotel as it advertised resident parking which was essential for the 3 minibuses our squad had. As it turned out it has a tiny lane which you would be lucky to be able to park a small car in and as a result we had to park at an expesive "otopark" along the street or on the street itself which was not appreciated by the locals. The windows were not sound proof and while the Hotel appears to be on a back a street- it is a very busy backstreet with heavy traffic and horns beeping form 5.30 am. Further the walls were paper thin and you could hear when anyone above flushed the toilet. Having said all this the staff were very friendly and the hotel was definately clean and comfortable although VERY basic. It was a good 20 minute walk to the Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque etc but it did allow you to see the real Istanbul! The breakfast was also basic. Baguettes, feta, tomato, cucumber etc or corn flakes. When we first arrived we immediately planned to find alternative accomodation once our competition was finished. however when the time came we were happy to spend the extra 3 nights here. While this hotel is nothing special it is fine if you are just looking for a cheap place to sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Tayhan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Turkeli Cad No. 9 | Kumkapi, Istanbul 34480, Turkey
